image.altText: A female in summer dress and ponytail stands next to daughter, 6 and son, 8, sitting at top of slide

props.synopsis: Families are facing crippling costs to educate their kids — even at public schools. It has led some to withdraw their children from hobbies and plan carefully simply to get them through school.

title.children: Parents turn to credit, grandparents in face of rising education costs

image.altText: A selfie of a bald man with glasses on his head.

props.synopsis: Jamie John Curtis tortured and raped a Tasmanian woman before murdering her fiance. On Wednesday, he's set to walk from jail for a third time after previously being locked back up for breaching his parole conditions.

title.children: Notorious murderer and rapist set to walk from prison, again

image.altText: Photo of frog on eucalyptus leaf

props.synopsis: A 13-year-old girl found and helped capture an invasive Peron's tree frog after a tourist's photo posted online alerted authorities of the biosecurity threat.

title.children: Invasive frog captured two weeks after sighting on Tasmanian lavender farm

image.altText: A man walking on the street in a suit

props.synopsis: Protesters disrupting logging in Tasmania appear to be gradually having trespass charges dropped by prosecutors, with 16 people walking free so far.

title.children: 'A bit peculiar': One by one, charges against logging protesters are being dropped

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka smiles and greets the crowd after her win

props.synopsis: Round two gets underway at the Australian Open today and features an all star cast of Aryna Sabalenka, Novak Djokovic, Coco Gauff and Alexander Zverev. Follow live.

title.children: Sabalenka and Djokovic headline day four at Australian Open

image.altText: A firefighter stands in a burnt door frame

props.synopsis: More powerful winds could set back the recent progress made in containing blazes in the Los Angeles area that have destroyed thousands of homes and killed at least 24 people. Follow live.

title.children: Winds strengthen as firefighters battle five blazes in southern California

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Scout Fire in Riverside County was deliberately set, fire department says
Los Angeles fire death toll rises to 25
Map: Fire breaks out in Riverside County

image.altText: Dozens of police stand outside the South Korean presidential residence next to a bus being used as a blockade

props.synopsis: South Korean authorities have detained impeached President President Yoon Suk Yeol after an hours-long stand-off.

title.children: Yoon Suk Yeol taken in for questioning after hours-long stand-off

image.altText: simon townsend

props.synopsis: Simon Townsend, best known for his role on the children's television show Wonder World, has died after recently being diagnosed with an aggressive cancer.

title.children: Wonder World host Simon Townsend dies aged 79

image.altText: Britain's Kate, the Princess of Wales.

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales, who had been receiving treatment for cancer, has confirmed she is in remission in a post on social media.

title.children: Princess Catherine announces she's 'in remission' from cancer

image.altText: Sam in a black coat being followed by cameras and journalists.

props.synopsis: The Matildas star has been charged with causing a police officer harassment, alarm or distress under the UK's Public Order Act.

title.children: Sam Kerr faces London court on racially aggravated harassment charges

image.altText: A close up of a yellow circle with black outlines of two faces with black writing that says "Guzman y Gomez Mexican Kitchen".

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading higher this afternoon, led by strong gains from Mexican-inspired fast food restaurant chain Guzman y Gomez after a positive note by UBS analysts. Follow live.

title.children: Upbeat outlook for Guzman y Gomez pushes shares higher, ASX up

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX boosted by academic, real estate stocks as Star continues to  climb
Musk lawyer responds to news of SEC court action
Elon Musk sued over late disclosure of Twitter stake

image.altText: A man pushing his way through rubble of a building, which left has concrete and steel rebar in a heap.

props.synopsis: Talks have been underway in Doha for hours in a bid to reach agreement on the final elements of a deal between Israel and Hamas.

title.children: Gaza ceasefire talks and hostage deal at 'sensitive stage'

image.altText: A mother and daughter play at a table inside a home

props.synopsis: A four-year-old girl is recovering after being viciously mauled by a Rottweiler at a WA beach while on holiday with her family.

title.children: Family holiday spot now 'place of fear' after 4yo mauled by dog

image.altText: A plane dropping water over smoky yellow landscape, with fire trucks on the ground.

props.synopsis: Aerial support had to be halted during a fire fight in the state's south last week due to recreational drones — a problem firefighters say is becoming more common.

title.children: Anger after drones ground water bombers fighting WA bushfire

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti mentioning Hitler and showing a swastika along a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The hand-picked representative for Jewish Australians, Jillian Segal, says a national cabinet meeting must be convened by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to respond to a spate of anti-Semitic attacks on home soil.

title.children: Anti-Semitism envoy urges national cabinet meeting after summer attacks

image.altText: A building at Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: Whyalla steelworks owner Sanjeev Gupta says there is still a long road ahead to profitability for the plant but its future remains uncertain and now there are calls for government intervention.

title.children: Calls to strip Whyalla steelworks from Sanjeev Gupta

image.altText: Crowds of people stand on a train station platform looking toward a stationary train.

props.synopsis: Sydney train commuters are experiencing significant delays amid ongoing industrial action on the rail network. Here's how the city's train network is being affected.

title.children: Chaos as Sydney train commuters face delays amid industrial action

image.altText: Queen Street Mall, Brisbane 2025-01-09 10:01:00

props.synopsis: An international team of researchers has found hundreds of new genetic variants linked to depression, which has the potential to lay the groundwork for new treatments.

title.children: 'Groundbreaking' global study finds hundreds more genes linked to depression

image.altText: A three storey house sits on top of someone else's yard.

props.synopsis: A McCrae resident evacuated on Tuesday after his house was impacted by a landslide has called for the issue to be fixed, as works continue to make the site safe for people to return.

title.children: Residents call for a solution after Mornington Peninsula landslide

image.altText: Daniel wears a hat and sunglasses and leans on his brick fence outside his house.

props.synopsis: New data shows rent rises may have peaked, with prices rising at almost half the rate of 2023. Sydney and Melbourne recorded the largest deceleration in price growth, and rental yields for investors in Brisbane and Adelaide dropped below Melbourne for the first time in more than 15 years.

title.children: Renters don't have capacity to pay much more so market may have peaked

image.altText: Sandy, greyish balls on the beach

props.synopsis: Investigations into more mysteriously shaped balls found at nine Sydney beaches are underway, as a prominent scientist hits out at the Environmental Protection Authority for dropping an investigation into similar debris.

title.children: Scientist criticises EPA for dropping probe into tar balls on NSW beaches

image.altText: Bush alight with fire at night time with smoke in the air

props.synopsis: One in 10 homes across Australia will be considered uninsurable within the next decade, according to climate change risk analysis modelling.

title.children: One in 10 homes could become uninsurable by 2035 climate analyst warns

image.altText: Two rescue workers in orange suits and helmets search rubble for survivors after an earthquake in a mountainous region.

props.synopsis: More than 120 people have been killed after a powerful earthquake struck a remote region of Tibet, but with limited media access and China's robust censorship program, it has been difficult for people to get reliable information and check on loved ones.

title.children: When Tibetans exposed quake damage, China sent a rumour-busting monk

image.altText: Orange flames in the sky

props.synopsis: The Russian military accused Kyiv of using US and British-supplied missiles and promised the strikes would "not go unanswered".

title.children: Russian schools, airports closed as Ukraine launches 'massive' strikes

image.altText: An aerial view of an exploration well in the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin on a patch of cleared land surrounded by bush

props.synopsis: The NT's environmental regulator is investigating the "inadvertent release" of highly salinated water near a fracking site in the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin. Environmental experts and advocates are warning the incident could be a sign of things to come.

title.children: Contaminated water pumped onto vegetation at Beetaloo Basin fracking site

image.altText: A Vietnamese police officer stands at an intersection crowded with motorbikes and push bikes

props.synopsis: Vietnam, where 11,500 people die in traffic accidents every year, has introduced severe new penalties for those who break road rules as well as bounties for those who dob them in.

title.children: Vietnam introduces traffic fines of up to half average income

image.altText: A person drinking water from a glass.

props.synopsis: "Forever chemicals" were recently found above levels currently considered safe in a handful of NSW drinking water sources. This is how PFAS-contaminated water is cleaned up before it reaches your kitchen tap.

title.children: Water treatment plants can remove PFAS contamination, but there's a catch

image.altText: Two hailstones sitting in the palm of a hand.

props.synopsis: More severe storms are predicted across the state today after strong winds, large hail, and storms hit parts of Queensland overnight.

title.children: Giant hail and 100km/h wind gusts batter parts of Queensland

props.synopsis: It came on the same day US President Joe Biden announced new measures that would allow data centres for artificial intelligence to be built on federal land.

title.children: US firms up crackdown on cars containing Chinese technology

image.altText: A pink slug crawls along a piece of bark on a wet ground.

props.synopsis: Citizen slug sleuths are helping scientists keep track of unique creatures that have made a remarkable comeback at Mount Kaputar in New South Wales.

title.children: Giant neon-pink slugs back with a vengeance after bushfires

image.altText: a nasal spray

props.synopsis: Nasal tanning sprays are illegal and can cause serious side effects according to Australia's drug and medical device watchdog.

title.children: Illegal tanning 'hack' not a 'harmless alternative', medicines watchdog says

image.altText: Cartoon image of boy with serious expression reaching hand into pool of ocean water.

props.synopsis: When Alison Lester's children's classic, Magic Beach, was written 35 years ago, it mirrored the childhood beach experience for so many. Now, a new film seeks to capture the same joy, whimsy and imagination.

title.children: Magic Beach captured how it feels as a kid on holiday, now it's a film
